group_1.narration: So she listened to it, note by note, @peering closely at each of the singing girls.
The goddess sought the point where these@newfound Magical Girls started singing.
Ah, just now... I heard something odd.
It was an impossibly small change,@compared to the vastness of the universe;@as small and insignificant as the sneeze of a flea.
The goddess stopped the record in haste and @stared at the evenly carved grooves on its surface.
And what did she find?
Evidence that a new groove was carved into it,@much like when she sings her blessing song.
And what's more...the groove was@still in the process of being carved.
It was the first time she'd seen the record,@the first time she heard those girls' songs,@and the first time an unfamiliar groove formed.
The unfamiliar songs had sprung@from that singular point.
Is this record playing bad music?
The goddess could not tell,@for the record was still in the throes@of its own creation.
I should give up on blessing it@with a song for now.
She had no choice. If she were to force@her voice in while a groove was forming,@the record may lose its direction.@It could even break.
The goddess chose to watch over it instead.
Though if this record does turn out@to be bad, I will have to destroy it...
When the record is complete, replete with @entrancing, strange, and terrifying songs...
Will the goddess snap the record in two?@Or will she bless it with her song as well?
Even the goddess does not know what she @will do...
Even the goddess does not know...
